title: Viral metagenomics using SMART-9n amplification and nanopore sequencing

source.description:
Transfer up to
sample directly onto a Ultrafree-MC Centrifugal Filter column

Spin at
for

Recover filtrate into
Eppendorf tube
Remove basket and discard
Close lid and place on ice

In a
Eppendorf tube combine
sample,
DNA/RNA Shield (2x concentrate) and mix well by pipetting

Add
Viral RNA Buffer and mix well by pipetting

Load
onto a column in a collection tube and spin at
for
discard flow through, place in a new collection tube

Add
Viral wash buffer and spin at
for
, discard flow through

Add
100% ethanol and spin at
for
, discard flow through, place in a clean
tube

Add
of DNA/RNA-Free Water and incubate at RT for

Spin at
for
Set heat block to

Set up the following reaction:
Component Volume
RNA
10X TURBO DNase Buffer
TURBO DNase
Total

Incubate at
for

Add
RNA Binding Buffer and mix by vortexing
and spin down

Add
100% ethanol and mix by vortexing for
and spin down

Transfer
to a Zymo-Spin IC column in a
collection tube and spin at
for
discard flow through

Add
RNA Prep Buffer and spin at
for
, discard flow through

Add
RNA Wash Buffer and spin at
for
, discard flow through and place in a new
Eppendorf tube

Add
DNase/RNase Free Water and incubate at RT for

Spin at
for
Label as ‘Viral RNA’ and place on ice
Set heat block to

In a
Eppendorf tube combine
sample,
DNA/RNA Shield (2X concentrate),
Proteinase K and mix well by pipetting

Incubate at
for
Set heat block to

Add
binding buffer and mix well

Load
onto a Zymo-Spin IIC-Z column in a collection tube and spin at
for
, discard the discard flow-through and reload as many times as required

Transfer to to a new collection tube add
DNA Wash Buffer 1 and spin at
for
, discard flow-through

Add
DNA Wash Buffer 2 and spin at
for
.

Add
DNA Wash Buffer 2 and spin at
for
.

Transfer to a new
Eppendorf tube and
DNA/RNA Free Water preheated to
to the column, incubate at RT for
.

Spin at
for
.

Combine the following in a 0.2ml 8-strip tube.
Component Volume
RLB RT 9N (2 uM)
dNTPs (10 mM ea.)
Template RNA
Total
Mix and spin down.

Incubate at
for
then snap cool on ice.

Make up the following master mix and add
to the
annealed RNA:
Component Volume
SSIV buffer (5x)
DTT (100 mM)
RNase OUT
SS IV RTase (200 U/ul)
RLB TSO (2 uM)
Total

Start the following program on a thermocycler:
for
for

Set up the following reaction to amplify cDNA in a new 0.2ml 8-strip tube:
Component Volume
LongAmp Taq 2X master mix
RLB (01-12)
NFW
cDNA
Total

Start the following program on the thermal cycler:
Step Temperature Time Cycles
Heat Activation
1
Denaturation
26
Annealing
26
Extension
26
Final extension
1
Hold
Indefinite 1
Clean up products with 1x Ampure XP and elute in 30 ul EB

source.description: Quantify the PCR products using the Quantus Fluorometer using the ONE dsDNA assay.

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d3qaq","text":"On the Home screen of the Quantus Fluorometer, select `Protocol`, then select `ONE DNA` as the assay type.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sac5","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b175n","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9j7c3","text":"If you have already performed a calibration for the selected assay you can continue, there is no need to perform repeat calibrations when using ONE DNA pre diluted dye solution. If you want to use the previous calibration, skip to step 11. Otherwise, continue with step 9.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"12969380E05911E98812198048CE0C80"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":61}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7i9b2","text":"On the home screen navigate to 'Sample Volume' and set it to  then 'Units' and set it to ng\/\u00b5L.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e1oh5","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"1A82D300E06911E9879DDDC406CE84AC","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6sb3l","text":"Repeat step 16 until all samples have been read.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

in
of

Add

Prime the flowcell and load sequencing library onto the flowcell.

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9s4pm","text":"If required place a new MinION flowcell onto the MinION by flipping open the lip and pushing one end of the flowcell under the clip and pushing down gently.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3eb75","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":5}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"665nm","text":"Load   of FLB (plus FLT) into the flow cell via the inlet port, dispense slowly and smoothly trying to avoid the introduction of any air bubbles.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"66ss6","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"800","guid":"A1366FE0E10B11E9B95CFFEF4066FA4A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tugf","text":"Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just prior to loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":8}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c2qqf","text":"Add the   library dilution to the flow cell via the SpotON sample port in a dropwise fashion. Ensure each drop siphons into the port before adding the next.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"242ej","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"75","guid":"9CAC8580E10C11E9B95CFFEF4066FA4A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ifau","text":"Gently replace the SpotON sample port cover, making sure the bung enters the SpotON port, close the inlet port and close the MinION lid.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c1vlu","text":"Rotate the inlet port cover clockwise by 90\u00b0 so that the priming port is visible.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":51}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"em9gk","text":"Take a P1000 pipette and tip and set the volume to  . Place the tip in the inlet port and holding perpendicularly to the plane of the flowell remove any air from the inlet port by turning the volume dial anti-clockwise.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ebpa7","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6m8ab","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3a8t8","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"800","guid":"A7A65850E10A11E9B95CFFEF4066FA4A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},{"type":"notes","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"90qn5","text":"Be careful not to remove so much volume that air is introduced onto the rectangular array via the outlet.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1E586470E10B11E9B95CFFEF4066FA4A"}}]}
{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3fm91","text":"Gently lift the SpotON cover to open the SpotON port.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":13}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"273pi","text":"Load another   of FLB (plus FLT) into the flow cell via the inlet port, this will initiate a siphon at the SpotON port to allow you to load the library dilution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"A1366FE0E10B11E9B95CFFEF4066FA4A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}]}

description: This is a SMART-Seq (Switch Mechanism at the 5′ End of RNA Templates) protocol developed to use random 9n priming and be compatible with ONT RLB rapid, barcoded adapters available from the SQK-RPB004 kit. We have generated cDNA reads in excess of 10 kb from Zika viral reference material with this protocol.
